DOC.brief_summary: The objective is to evaluate the feasibility of using color Doppler ultrasound in ureteral flow assessment after uterine artery occlusion during a conservative gynecological procedure.
DOC.brief_title: Uretal Flow Assessment During Gynecological Procedures
DOC.criteria: Meets criteria for conservative gynecological procedure At least 25 years of age Cervix suitable for tenaculum placement Provides written informed consent. Pregnancy One or more lower uterine segment fibroids Hydronephrosis as determined by renal ultrasound preprocedurally Clinical diagnosis of urinary tract infection (UTI) In the medical judgment of the physician, such a procedure may compromise the patient's condition Inability to achieve bilateral occlusion with the clamp placement during the procedure.
